title: Business Operations Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very informal, it somewhat felt like I was discussing with a good friend. I felt very comfortable with the interviewer. Majority of the questions were situation-based interview questions. For example, tell me about a time you had difficulty completing a task.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you faced a challenge and how did you overcome it...

title: Unit Secretary Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview questions were repetitive. Showed you around the facility and let you talk with co workers. Kind of waste of time if you don’t get the job. It’s not even management that’s interviewing you. They have nurses as well
Interview Questions: What executive steps have you made and what was the outcome?

title: PCT/CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: I remember interviewing for my role and the manager made a weird remark to me saying that if hired to make sure I didn’t have an attitude problem or like drama or to argue and to be positive; just like i was during the interview . I thought that was a very strange remark to make since I was very excited to be there and have always been professional at work. The POC at a different hospital i worked at weren’t surprised when they heard about this occurring during their interview process at all. When I talked about it with non-POC they were extremely surprised and said that’s never happened to them.
Interview Questions: One question i was asked was how would you describe yourself.

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Chamblee, GA)
Interview Descriptions: the interview process was very good. The manager was very nice and made me feel very welcome. i didn't feel intimidated. she made me feel very comfortable and explain the process and answered all my questions.
Interview Questions: what was one challenge than you went through and over came?

title: Compensation Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta
Interview Descriptions: Smooth interview. I applied 1 month before I got an email from the recruiter. I had my phone screen and then my in person interview. I had to take an excel assessment. 1 week later, I got a phone call saying I got the job!
Interview Questions: They were more personality based questions vs. job questions

title: safety support specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2023
Interview Descriptions: I had a very straight-forward and incredibly informative interview that left me with a deep sense of admiration for the confident and knowledgeable interviewer. Without a doubt, the atmosphere created during the interview was one that resonated with me, igniting a strong desire within to become a part of the team and work in such a positive and invigorating environment. The entire experience was nothing short of exceptional, providing valuable insights and leaving a lasting impression that affirmed my eagerness to be a part of this incredible opportunity.
Interview Questions: Experience within the medical environment

title: Nurse Residency Program Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: Video recording answering 4-5 questions, where you have 3 chances to record yourself. Then you will be interviewed by a recruiter if they like your responses and resume. Lastly, interview with unit managers and shadowing.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to become a nurse? What specialties are you interested in and why?

title: Analytic Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: Had the phone screen in 10 mins with the recruiter. Then, I received interview schedule in same week. The interview was an hour with 2 people. The conversation was nice. They asked a lot about the previous projects and experiences, some simple technical questions about coding . They informed the last round which will be in-person interview with technical exams.
Interview Questions: Describe your previous project which is the most interesting to you.

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta
Interview Descriptions: Normal interview, one interviewee asks pointed / situational questions where they want you to answer in STAR format. Other interviews were normal format, no hard / different questions. Did not get a response back after my interview
Interview Questions: What is a recent challenge you faced and how did you overcome it.

title: Communications Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: The initial interview was virtual (led by two people) and very typical for the type of position. They dove into past work and qualifications as well as their vision for the role. The second interview was in-person and involved a timed writing test. They gave roughly 45 minutes to complete two prompts.
Interview Questions: Q: Tell us about the specific types of communications you have experience writing.

title: Nurse Residency Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Video interview after you apply then phone screening with a recruiter to talk about your interest, why did you pick nursing and about the residency program, then you shadow and interview with your unit. Situational based interview questions
Interview Questions: Tell me about how you handled conflict

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Good, fair questions were asked. Many concerning previous work experience. Posititve environment. Role was described thoroughly and the tour of the facility was informative. Everyone was eager and displayed a positive attitude. Teamwork was encouraged.
Interview Questions: How to deal with difficult employees?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta
Interview Descriptions: Great! Once I talked to a recruiter, it was a seamless process to an online Webex interview where I spoke with an assistant nurse manager and a manager. The interview was short as I am a re-hire for the company
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time where you made a mistake

title: Patient Registrar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: Smooth sailing. The interviewer was very laid back making the interview process seamless. I answered all questions promptly and effectively. I was also able to prepare efficiently prior to my interview. Anyone having an upcoming interview with CHOA, Good luck and wishing you all the best!
Interview Questions: What made you decide to apply to CHOA?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta
Interview Descriptions: After submission of application, I was emailed to have a video interview and then was followed up with a phone call and offer for an in-person interview on the unit.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at CHOA?

title: Nurse Resident Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta
Interview Descriptions: Behavioral health questions and shadowing afterwards. The interviewers were really nice and it was a casual interview. Overall great experience and nice hospital and staff. Would recommend working here. Nurses were young and since it’s a teaching hospital there is a lot to learn.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a nurse.

title: PCT Patient Care Tech Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta
Interview Descriptions: Great process to get an interview they are very friendly understanding and makes it well worth your time and appreciate the work and position that you are offered I am delighted and over exstatic to be offered a interview here I have been trying for so long to get a position here at this hospital I love it I love kids and I’m glad that I can make a differe
Interview Questions: Basics questions and just knowing what to do

title: Patient Safety Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was very easy. It didn’t last a long time, but they continued to ask if I had any questions in between their explanation of the job, which I appreciated.
Interview Questions: What experience do I have with kids dealing with mental health concerns.

title: Scheduler Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta
Interview Descriptions: I was first contacted to do a phone interview where I had to answer a series of questions. After that, I was scheduled for an in-person interview with the department manager.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Children’s?

title: Pediatrician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta
Interview Descriptions: Interview through recruiter and through the team. After interviewing with the team you meet the staff and explore the facility. The interview process is thorough and smooth.  The recruiter talks to you through most of the process.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in working at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta

title: NICU RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta
Interview Descriptions:
It was a 1 hour + 2 hour shadow.  Questions were all situational - none of the "Tell me about yourself..."
It was more "tell me about a time when ____" with questions having varying difficulties. They make you feel comfortable & schedule at a time that works for you.
Interview Questions: Tell me about the last time you went through a high pressure situation.

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions:
I was asked several behavioral questions, for which I used the STAR method to answer them. I was also asked about my past experience, and I could tell they reviewed my resume because they asked questions about my experience and how to apply it to my current position. 

The interview was a total of 15-20 min
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you disagreed with a nurse. How did you navigate that conversation?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta
Interview Descriptions:
Videoing self answering questions, recruiter phone call, 1 1/2 hour interview and 2 hrs of shadowing on the unit. 
Was interviewed by the nurse educator and the unit manager. Lots of questions about tell us a time that such and such happened and how you responded.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you spoke up about something wrong that was going on?

title: Registration Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Alpharetta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: Fairly easy. Applied for position on a saturday. Heard from recruiter on tuesday. Interviewed that Wednesday. Spoke with recruiter first then interview to discuss role and schedule in person interview. Next I interviewed with department leader. Job was offered the same day.
Interview Questions: Describe  your work style, why this company, what are your personal interest

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was a panel interview with 4 managers that lasted about an hour. Was an overall easy interview and all of the interviewers were super nice and really easy to talk to.
Interview Questions: From prior experience, how did you quickly communicate something to do with research to a physician or a clinical personnel?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta
Interview Descriptions: It was a phone interview screening applicants to see if you have credentials you may need.. Than a  Video interview. Asked scenario based questions. Maybe like 8 questions. Then went over the next steps.
Interview Questions: How do you handle difficult situations.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta
Interview Descriptions: Around two or three managers interview you. Ask typical scenario questions “tell me a time when..” “how did you handle” not to intense. Not a bad interview, no need to stress.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years

title: Patient Safety Sitter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta
Interview Descriptions: The interview was amazing, everything was very straight foward. The recruiter and the person who interviewed did wonderful. I really enjoyed it. Very helpful i enjoyed it. Awesome lit good vibes
Interview Questions: What do you like about this position.

title: Registered Respiratory Therapist (RRT) Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: Zoom call with all managers/ supervisors, and clinical educators. Pretty simple, webcam must be on but theirs is not. Pretty straight forward. Series of questions asked.  You will most likely know if you got the job by the end of the interview
Interview Questions: Describe how an asthmatic patient would present

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: it was on zoom, everyone was friendly, and it was also brief. I had time to answer their questions, but also had time to ask them questions as well. Overall, great experience.
Interview Questions: How to handle a problem-which they provided

title: Scheduler Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, spoke with recruiter, interviewed. Interview was easy: offered the job but declined due to incredibly low offer. They only wanted to use my professional experience that was in the healthcare industry only.
Interview Questions: They use the star method

title: 2022 Nurse Extern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: hire vue, was simplistic and easy to understand, questions were not over the top difficult and were easy to understand, able to show personality through videos. Asked preferences for units, why you want to be a nurse, why choa,
Interview Questions: why do you want to be a nurse

title: Registration Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Duluth, GA) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: I spoke with the employer for about 45 minutes about the job and what I’ve done in the past. Only about 10 minutes were spent talking about questions related to what I would contribute to the company.
Interview Questions: How would you respond to an upset patient?

title: Summer Nurse Extern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: I received an email with a link to complete a video interview after turning in an online application.  They give you a few practice questions to get used to the formatting, time limit, and overall technology which was very useful.
Interview Questions: What makes you a unique candidate?

title: Family Experience Liaison Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta
Interview Descriptions: I had to interview with 3 different people not including initial screen interview the last interview was where I shadowed for a day and then talked with three of the providers I would be working beside.
Interview Questions: How would I handle emotionally the difficult aspects of the job

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta
Interview Descriptions: Great. Virtual. Question straight forward. Waiting on call back. Been a week. 30 seconds prep. 1 minute answering. 9 questions. Got email about three days after applying. Quick application process. Uploaded resume. Good luck
Interview Questions: Why Children’s healthcare of Atlanta?

title: Lead Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta
Interview Descriptions: A series of interviews with clinical and nonclinical stakeholders. Initial interview was with the hiring manager and utilized the STAR (Situation - Task - Action - Result) method for behavioral interviewing
Interview Questions: Share a time you supported a team member that was struggling.

title: Paramedic Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was a very good experience. I loved every minute of it. It’s a very welcoming environment. Friendly staff, they explain everything well. I would have to say this was the best interview process I have ever been apart of. They get a 10/10.
Interview Questions: Easy to answer, they make sure they are hiring qualified people

title: RBT - Registered Behavior Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta
Interview Descriptions:
Virtual and in person interview. The tour/in person interview gives you a very good perspective of what to expect when working at the facility.  The place allows you to speak with other staff members to also get their 
perspective and experience working there.
Interview Questions: How do you work in team settings?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta
Interview Descriptions: There’s two rounds of interview. First round is a phone interview where an operator will ask you 10 questions. Once those questions are answered, if the recruiter sees an interest in you then they will submit it to the hiring manager of the location you’re interested and will be interviewed again which is the second round. Shortly after the second interview you’re recruiter will reach out to you within 1-3 weeks about a decision or simply look after the results in the profile section in CHOA Careers page.
Interview Questions: What made you choose CHOA?

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta
Interview Descriptions: I think overall the interview questions were straight to the point. The questions asked were basic behavioral questions. I was at ease answering the questions. I had three interviewers the clinical research lead and the PI.
Interview Questions: what is your long term goal

title: New Grad RN Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: Applied online to the new grad RN program. The following day, I received an email from HireVue, a virtual interviewing platform. I recorded myself answering some basic interview questions (walk me through your resume; why CHOA?). The day after that, I received an email from a recruiter who asked to set up a time to speak on the phone. She asked my what units I want to work on and why. She sent my resume to the unit director who decided she wanted to meet with me. The recruiter and I then scheduled an in-person interview as well as a 2-3 hour shadowing experience on the unit. The entire process took almost 1 month.
Interview Questions:
(1) Describe a time you made a mistake,
(2) Describe a time you experienced a high-stress situation,
(3) Who are you outside of your professional life?
(4) What are your short-term and long-term goals?
(5) Describe a time where you saw a patient who had a diagnosis you've never heard of before. How did you go about learning about this diagnosis?

title: Investment Operations Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: The process went well until I provided references.  I was told that my references did not have enough specific examples of my work and I came to find out that at least one of the three references wasn’t even contacted.
Interview Questions: What are three adjectives to describe you?

title: Regsistered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, got hirevue link within a day after applying, email and phone call sent within a week to set up in person interview. Very chill questions. Interview with multiple managers and get to shadow for an hour after.
Interview Questions: What are your Strengths and weaknesses

title: Patient Care Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: The entire process from asking me to interview and from when I got interviewed has taken a month so far. I have not received an offer yet but fingers crossed.
Interview Questions:
describe a time with a difficult coworker
Why CHOA

title: New Grad Nurse Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: First Round Virtual HireVue Interview. Question prompts given with 30 seconds of prep time before it recorded you for 3 minutes. Both 30 sec prep time and 3 min answer time could be overridden and cut short as wanted.
Interview Questions:
Why Children's?
What made you want to go into nursing?

title: Radiologic Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview was pleasant. There were 2 people conducting the interview. They asked situation questions, like what would you do in certain situations. Overall I had a good experience. The interview lasted about 30 mins.
Interview Questions: Have you had a past situation where you had conflict with a superior and how did you handle it.

title: Wellness Screener Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: First you have to introduce yourself then the interviewer asks questions and listens to your response.Interview went really well and smooth. Interviewer made me feel comfortable.  Easy questions asked during the interview . Just be yourself  Interview process was quick.
Interview Questions: What made you interest working for children's?

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: Informational interview discussed the job role. I was called by the head of the department. I felt pretty unprepared and did not realize that I had been given an informal interview.
Interview Questions: They asked me about relocation, what the role involved and my experience.

title: Registration Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by the department manager for an interview after speaking with a CHOA recruiter via phone. The interview was quite informative and asked a lot of questions regarding scenarios and examples from previous work history.
Interview Questions: How did you handle conflict with a difficult coworker?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta
Interview Descriptions: Online, film yourself answering questions such as greatest strengths, weaknesses, Etc. Kind of awkward to film oneself with no one on other side but not terrible. Friendly people but I did not, unfortunately receive the job
Interview Questions: What are your greatest strengths

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta
Interview Descriptions: The process wasn't complicated but with the increase in competition it may take some time to truly get a call back or interview. Be open and bubbly in the interview!
Interview Questions: How do I see children as the focal point of my care that I will give?

title: New Graduate RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta
Interview Descriptions: I did a Hirevue interview first and then I was called and offered an in-person interview. The in-person interview was an hour long and then I did a 2 hour unit shadow with a few of the nurses.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you made a mistake.

title: Maintenance Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta
Interview Descriptions: Round table style interview with multiple supervisors and upper management laid back and very open atmosphere. They asked general knowledge questions then questions about me past experiences and my goals for the position I applied for.
Interview Questions: What approach would I take to handle work place productivity issues

title: Licensed Clinical Social Worker LCSW Interview
Application Type: The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Seward, NE)
Interview Descriptions: Applied on a Friday, was contacted by a recruiter that following Monday to get more background on my experience and what kind of schedule I would like. 2 days later got a call from  another recruiter to set up an interview for Friday. Interview went well, lasted about an hour. It was done over web Ex, had som tech issues at first, but we figured it out quickly
Interview Questions: How do you stay organized to meet deadlines.

title: Clinical Nurse II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta
Interview Descriptions: It takes a while to get into CHOA.  First, there’s a phone screening with HR.  Then, there was a phone interview with the hiring manager, and a final interview in person.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years.

title: Public Relations Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was fantastic, with a knowledgable recruiter who showed real care for getting to know me as a person and a candidate. They are very value-based and intentional.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you were challenged. What did you do?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: Lots of steps during the interview process, but worth it if you want to be hired as an RN after nursing school. Make sure you have good references, be sure to highlight your attributes, and be very enthusiastic!
Interview Questions: Be prepared to answer situational questions or recall incidents where you went above and beyond or made a mistake and learned from it - things like that.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: I was called by a recruiter to discuss the job and my qualifications. Then I was invited to shadow and interview in person at Egleston. Everyone makes you feel so welcome, which makes it harder when you don't get the position.
Interview Questions:
Why Children's?
Give an example of a time you had to de-escalate a situation. 
What was your most difficult patient?

title: Nurse Residency Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta
Interview Descriptions: The first interview was all online and you are video taped. There is no way you are actually speaking with.  The interview gives you 30 seconds to read a question and then 2 minutes to answer.
Interview Questions: Explain a situation where you had to stand up to a superior?

title: Marketing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was organized and communicated well. I always felt like I was in the loop with the status of my application and next steps, and the steps moved quickly after I was contacted for a first interview.
Interview Questions: The usual questions: 5-year plan, previous experience, why you're suited for this role, etc.?

title: Executive Director Tech Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta
Interview Descriptions: Fairly simple! I did one interview with the manager of the floor as well as a another employee I believe a clinical educator.  It was followed by a shadowing experience with another employee for a few hours.
Interview Questions: Why did you pick children’s?

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: A recruiter called me the day after I submitted my resume and seemed like they were very interested. They told me the salary on the initial call which I appreciated. I met with the program manager about 1.5 weeks later, did a second interview the next week and a third the week after. It took over a week to hear back after that last interview, but ultimately I took another position. Interview process was standard.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at CHOA

title: NICU RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: So far it’s been wonderful. Recruiter, nurse manager and staff we so sincere, informative and nice! I had my interview yesterday and am waiting to hear back. Checking my email every five minutes!
Interview Questions: Personal and work experience related

title: Recruiting Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: The manager called to verify where I lived and once she realized I didn't live in Atlanta she told me they were no longer interested because the job would be starting in two weeks and that's not enough time to move there. They could definitely use some unconscious bias training! I expect more from a manager.
Interview Questions: She only asked questions about the city I lived in. She didn't ask any questions about my experience.

title: Public Relations Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: They were very kind. They walked me through every step. The building was beautiful. They seem to be a tight knit team. I had several interviews over the phone first.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in CHOA?

title: Nurse Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta
Interview Descriptions: Fairly easy. It was an online interview. Questions were challenging . I had to answer both video questions and had some written questions. I haven’t heard back yet status still says under review
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at children’s hospital of Atlanta

title: Pcs Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta
Interview Descriptions: If they really want to hire you..you will hear back fairly soon. It is important to let them know something that separates you from the other applicants. Something unique that could apply to how you would work better with children.
Interview Questions: When have you been in a difficult situation and how did you resolve it?

title: Scheduler Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta
Interview Descriptions: The interview process took a few weeks like 2 weeks at the most. It was pretty smooth within the two weeks I would call to hear the status of my interview.
Interview Questions: Q: What would be most important to do first if there’s a high call volume & a ton of emails you’ll need to respond to

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Tampa, FL) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions:
The first interview was on HireVue where you are prompted with a question and have 30 seconds to think of an answer before you have to record your answer. You only have 1 try to record your answer and have around 2 minutes worth of time to record your answer. Kinda nerve racking but wasn’t too bad. I got an email not too long after I finished that part until I got a call from a recruiter who wanted to see what my interests were. 

Following that someone from the unit called me to schedule another interview, which was virtual because of COVID. Really good interview. Took about 45 minutes. Got an offer the next day and accepted
Interview Questions: Tell me a time where you had to be resilient

title: Nurse Residency Program Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta
Interview Descriptions: I applied on Children's Healthcare of Atlanta's website and got an email 3 weeks later for an interview through Hirevue. I haven't heard back from them yet. Hopefully I will know something soon.
Interview Questions: Why do I want to work at CHOA?

title: Sterile Processing Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: They will ask you to put together a minor tray from the count sheet. They make ask questions about the Sterilization method and if you are familiar with the case carts.
Interview Questions: What's the average temp for the steam sterilizer.

title: Nurse Resident Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: The virtual interview included a computer screen asking 10 questions. The interviewee recorded herself/himself answering each question. There was no interviewer. It was difficult to feel confident about the interview since there was no person responding to you.  However, it was less intimidating than a normal interview since you are only speaking to a computer screen.
Interview Questions: Name a time when you went above and beyond for a patient.

title: Nurse Extern Interview

title: Practice Operations Supervisor Interview

title: Manager Interview

title: Feeding Technician Interview

title: New Grad Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta
Interview Descriptions: I had a great experience during the interview process, which made me want to work at CHOA even more.  For the New Grad program, you submit an online application.  Once that’s reviewed, you may get an invitation to complete a digital interview.  I received that the day after I submitted my application then I had 3 business days to complete the digital interview (using an app to record answers to questions).   After about 6-7 weeks I got a call from my recruiter about setting up an in-person interview.  They’ll work with you on this part to try to get you the interview with your top unit choices if they think you are a good candidate.  I’ve been told that if you interview with a unit and don’t get the job, they will keep getting you interviews until all spots are filled. So if you don’t get your top choice, you can still do a second interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you went above and beyond for a patient of yours.

title: Strategic Account Executive Interview

title: Associate Interview

Afterwards, I NEVER heard back. I have never talked to a company that did not have the professional courtesy to email me back, even if I didn't get the job. Unprofessional.

title: Applications Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Many interviews ask behavioral- based interview questions and look for STAR answers. The STAR method is a structured manner of responding to a behavioral-based interview question by discussing the specific situation, task, action, and result of the situation you are describing.

title: RT Interview

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Douglasville, GA) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions:
I applied for the job and was contacted by a recruiter via email one week later to set up a phone interview. I then had a phone interview with the recruiter. Basic questions (why do you want to leave your current position, tell me about yourself, etc.) She found my skill set relevant for the position and moved forward by sending my info to the nurse manager. One week later, I was contacted by a nurse manager for a formal interview and shadowing the following week. The interview was fairly simple, professional but also casual (if that makes sense.) It lasted approximately one hour. Shadowing was approximately 2.5 hours. 
I was offered the job the same day.
Interview Questions: Why are you leaving your current position?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: I got a call from the recruiter after having applied online maybe a month after. The recruiter called and set me up for an in-person interview with two people panel which were the Director and Manager of the department. They asked a series of Behavioral and Situational questions. Then for the last portion of the interview talked about the role of the position. It lasted about an hour fifteen minutes Afterwards, on the same day a recruiter called me again to say they enjoyed the interview and wanted to set up a second interview but also wanted to get background and references started in the interim. The second interview was another panel set for a couple days later with the head scheduler and the Clinical Manager. They asked straightforward background questions i.e. Take me through your resume, Can you tell me about this on your resume, etc. Then took me on a tour of the facilities. Interview lasted about an hour and a half. Didn't hear anything on that day but got a callback on the next day with an offer.
Interview Questions: Behavioral - Tell me about a time you had a conflict with a coworker, Tell me about a time you solved a problem, Tell me about your experience...

title: Financial Counselor Interview

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2019

Interview Questions: Why I wanted to work for Childrens hospital.

title: Financial Operations Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions:
I submitted my resume through the company web site, and a recruiter reached out a week or so later, which led to a 30-minute phone screen.  After that I was invited to a 3 hour in-person interview with the hiring manager, the hiring manager’s boss and another associate.  Had good conversations with all three of them.  Everyone I spoke to during the entire process, including the recruiter, was super friendly, positive and professional, and they were all passionate about the organization.  I followed up with the recruiter via e-mail a couple of times over the following two weeks to express my continued interest, and inquire about next steps.  No response at all.  

After 2 1/2 weeks I finally received a canned e-mail from their applicant tracking system saying that they were going to “pursue other candidates.” Now it was pretty evident that I was well-qualified for the position, so that wasn’t the issue.  Whatever the reason for them deciding that they want to “pursue other candidates” that’s fine, there are lots of qualified people out there.  But good grief, at least have the courtesy to reach out with an e-mail from an actual person or take 2 minutes to call me to let me know instead of ghosting on me, and eventually getting around to sending a boiler plate e-mail from a robot!  Especially  after I’ve invested 3 1/2 hours of my time interviewing, and they’ve invested 3 1/2 man-hours on their end too!  I found it very unprofessional, and in stark contrast to the entire interview experience up until that point.  I would have considered the overall experience a positive one, and would have even wanted to stay connected with the people I interviewed with despite not getting a job offer, but getting blown off like that really left a bad taste in my mouth about Children’s Healthcare.
Interview Questions: It was mostly conversational, although one person asked a handful of behavioral-type questions.

title: Patient Safety Sitter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: interviewed then took a tour of hospital .  nurse was nice snd easy tp talk to.  she asked me to tell her about each Company i worked for. why did i leave

title: Patient Accounts Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of 2 managers at a time. The first two managers were nice and professional. The second two managers came across as being very insecure and the gentleman appeared to be somewhat sarcastic. It was very awkward.
Interview Questions: What made you want to apply for the position?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Put in application about 1 month or so. 2 weeks after that received a email from the Lead Coordinator stating she received my application from recruiter and wanted to set up phone interview.  Did the phone interview and it went great. She stated she was going to call me back with details and never heard nothing back. Sent a follow up email, no reply.
Interview Questions: How long have you been a research coordinator?

title: Clinical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was referred by a nurse that worked there. I heard from a nurse recruiter the next day. A few weeks later, I was called to go in for an interview. I was offered the job after the interview. I was interviewed by three nurse managers at once.
Interview Questions: How do you prioritize patients when you have a heavy load? Describe a time when you had a difficult patient or family member, what did you do?

title: Patient Registration Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta
Interview Descriptions: I completed a FaceTime interview via Hirevue (no pressure). I then completed a  Face to Face interview with hiring manager, and after about a week, I received an offer and accepted it!
Interview Questions: When was a time you turned a bad situation around?

title: Nurse Extern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta
Interview Descriptions: Process begins with a 14 question video based interview, asking herbal questions about why nursing, why CHOA, what you want to do, etc. Then continues with an inperson/phone interview and a reference check.
Interview Questions: What kind of nurse do you want to be?

title: Anonymous Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Got a call from hr about 3 weeks later. She scheduled an interview with the hiring manager. It was a panel interview with 4 other people. I was asked basic behavioral questions. I prepared a week in advance. Googled behavioral questions. It gave me a good idea and helped with my nerves. Everyone was sweet and easy to talk to.
Interview Questions: Conflict resolution questions were asked more than one. Just worded differently.

title: Applications Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process consisted of an initial screen by the Technical Recruiter where the questions were primarily about my background and why I was interested in the company to determine a good fit for the culture. The second interview was a technical screen for the position and the final interview was a team setting interview of approximately 8 people.
Interview Questions: Knowledge of Sitecore and how it related to my .NET background.

title: Pediatric Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very long! It was difficult to get any response for several months. I met with several people along the way, and got great feedback. At the end of the day, they gave the position to someone who had 12 years of experience. I have heard this is not uncommon at CHOA to rely heavily on experience.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work with kids?

title: Buyer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions:
First step is a phone interview with HR to qualify. Then you will get a second phone interview with the managers that last about an hour to get to know you and your background. Last step is to meet in person with the managers do a panel interview of scripted questions. 

Had to follow up with HR to find out I wasn’t selected. They should email everyone that goes through this long process.
Interview Questions: What challenges have you faced and how did you overcome them.

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Hiring process was quicker than I expected. Received a phone call from recruiter 2 days after applying online. After a week and a half I received an in person interview with 3 lead research coordinators. Interview was filled with task based questions and questions about my background. Second interview a week later with clinical research manager and lead research nurse and all the questions were straightforward backgrounds and research experience. Got a call the same day with a job offer
Interview Questions: Why did you choose CHOA?

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Havent done it yet, i am currently doing this because i want to have a heads up on interviw questions. I dont know why I have to fill this out if I have not had the interview yet, so yeah thats why ha ha ha
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself today

title: Communications/Public Relations Director Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was thorough and included 5 visits with a top VP and during the 5th, he made me an offer. He asked great questions and was a good listener, also.
Interview Questions: Why I wanted to work for an institution that prioritizes children's health?

title: Anonymous Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and  got a call for interview the next day. Went in for an interview which was very straight and  got offered a position  after interview on the same day
Interview Questions: Why do you wanna work at Children's?

title: Patient Care Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was an easy going interview. I did the digital interview. I answered a few basic questions about myself and why I chose CHOA. It was pleasant and quick. CHOA has Avery good reputation.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose CHOA

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received both a phone interview and a FaceTime interview because I was not local. The experience as a whole was very positive. The interview felt very conversational and consisted of many situational questions.
Interview Questions: Why Children's Healthcare of Atlanta?

title: Registrar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: It went by fairly quickly. I received a call from a recruiter 1 week after applying online. I set up an interview for the following week. We had a group panel and in a few days was offered the position.
Interview Questions: What experiences have I had registering children?

title: Business Operations Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Very lengthy process. Applied in October 2017. Did online video interview a few days after applying.  Received phone call about an in person interview January 2018. Never heard anything back. I do wish companies would at least take the time to let candidates know that they weren't picked for the position instead of leaving us wondering and then seeing online that the position is closed without any word from anyone else. Aside from that, overall positive experience. Everyone was very nice at the hospital itself. 
Mainly just asked situational questions, asking what you would do/or what you have done when in a certain situation.
Interview Questions: What did you do when dealing with problems in a group setting?

title: Family Experience Liaison Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: I had a telephone interview and an in-person interview on the specific hospital wing that I would prove customer service care to. I was made to feel extremely comfortable in the interview and afterwards I was given a tour of that specific hospital unit. I got the job but even if I hadn't, the tour helped ease any tension and gave me the opportunity to see the environment I would work in and the people I'd work with.
Interview Questions: One question that I scrambled to find an answer for: Give me an example of an experience in the workplace where I had a conflict with a coworker and how I fixed it.

title: Nurse Extern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Fill out an application online and then it is an online interview with references and followed by an in person one if asked back. The process was very lengthy and they only accept about 30-40 applicants.
Interview Questions: What are your top 3 units you want to work in and why?

title: Radiology EMR Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was basically a panel interview with the manager and the lead team member. They both asked interview questions. They asked about my background. After the interview, they showed me around the work space.
Interview Questions: If you were in a conflicting situation with a colleague, how would you handle that?

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was quick considering I was a referred applicant. It was almost scary because it all happened so quickly. I can say I was a worthy applicant and employee, but this process should not be as easy for every one.
Interview Questions: Have you ever had experience with making IV medications?

title: Wellness Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta
Interview Descriptions: Applied online over and over online throughout the years. Despite having advanced edu and experience have been rejected without so much as a call. ATS sucks and this is why HR at companies like this perpetuate the lack of success both internally and externally. Try reading the applicant's resume and speaking to them instead of utilizing a useless ATS to rely on qualified candidates. Your reputation relies on your HR dept and hiring practices.
Interview Questions: NO questions asked - just a constant rejection without merit. I am more than qualified and have been sent repeated rejections

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: I had a recruiter ask me questions about my research experience and salary expectations over the phone. Then I had my first interview with the department I would be working with. After two days I had a second interview with the department head. I was asked when I could start the position only to find out I did not get the job. Unfortunately, I was led on to believe I had the job which was not professional.
Interview Questions: What are your research interests? Are you interested in sickle cell disease?

title: Pct Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (McDonough, GA) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: I filled out an app and about a little over a week. I received an audio invite to take a interview via email. 1 week exact, the recruiter called me in for a in person interview. 1 more week exact later they called and offered me the job. So about a 3 week turn a round for me.
Interview Questions: Have you ever had a conflict with another staff member? If so how did you resolve it?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Fairly easy interview process. Very relatable interviewers . The interview itself only took about 30 min. Asked some casual questions to get the ball rolling. Overall the interview process was exactly how I expected it.
Interview Questions: How long do you plan on being with choa? What does your academic classwork bring to the table?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: The process took some time.  Interviewed with multiple leaders before the final decision was made.  The entire process took place over a few months.  I was asked to present a case review in front of a panel.
Interview Questions: How do you see growing this position over the next year?

title: Data Management Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta
Interview Descriptions: The whole process took 2 months , I received a phone call from recruiter then phone interview then 2 times personal interviews , first was with several people and last with the manager .
Interview Questions:
what statistical softwares did you use in your analysis? ?
many other alot different types of questions

title: Benefits Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview started with a couple of phone interviews with recruiting where you walk through your background and why you are interested.  Then they bring you in for  multi-round in person interviews with people you might be working with.
Interview Questions: how would you handle a situation where someone does not agree with you?

title: Weekend Coverage Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Screened via phone by Human Resources. Then face to face three person panel interview in department. Given a few days to prepare for interview. Response ten days after interview. Good experience & responsiveness.
Interview Questions: How to prioritize multiple tasks?

title: BI Quantitative Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: First is the HR interview, then the hiring manager, both phone interviews, did not get the onsite interview.  Both are friendly and relax. last for 40 min for the second round. first round is short about 10 min.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with conflicts with colleagues?

title: IT Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions:
The first interview was a phone interview that covered technical questions (difference between a router and a switch, difference between HTTP and HTML, etc).

The second interview was a 30 minute interview at the Children's office where the job was located. It was with the hiring manager, and was an informal/unscripted interview. There were not many technical questions asked. The only technical questions were pertinent to items listed on my resume.
Interview Questions: Difference between HTTP and HTML, talk about my resume experiences, etc...

title: Patient Registration Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was great.  Received a tour of the facility and manager and supervisor were in attendance. Pretty standard questions and both were very nice and inviting. Great culture, looking forward to hearing back soon.
Interview Questions: Describe a time I received an unreasonable request from a customer/ patient.

title: Behavioral Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Interviewed for two separate positions.  A few hours after submitting my first application I interviewed through hirevue. You have 30 seconds to prepare to answer each question and 3 minutes for your answer. Once you answer you cannot redo anything. 
A few hours after doing my interview I received my first offer to interview in person. Questions were "behavioral" and involve answering questions about handling past experiences in a STAR (look it up) format. 
My interview for a different position was similar because the question format was the same.  Interviewers were friendly, and made the experience stress free. I received a call and email stating I received an offer 3 days after my interview.
Interview Questions: What are your short term and long term career goals?

title: Behavioral Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was a screening interview done through HireVue. It gives you 30 seconds to read and prepare your answer and another 3 minutes to record your answer via video and audio recording.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for CHOA?

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Got an invite to online interview  4 days later. Got the in person interview 3 days after that and was offered the job before the end of that day.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have?

title: Investment Operations Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Had an initial screening interview with a recruiter.  Was told regardless of whether or not I was moving forward she would be contacting me within a week or two. I haven't heard from her and this interview was 4 weeks ago.

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Two person interview. Know your basic medical terminology. Typical interview questions. Be professional, and just know medical terminology. Know situational questions & answers. I really can't remember b/c it's been so long ago.
Interview Questions: Where is a gtube?

title: Trainer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: They conduct panel interviews following targeted selection method. Have STAR answers ready to go! The follow up (interview 2) is a simulated classroom teaching experience where you are the teacher and prepare a handout.
Interview Questions: Questions asked to "describe s time when..." followed by requests for achieving success, confronting challenges, etc. They want to know the situation, task, what action you took and the (measurable) results.

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and then was contacted a few months later for a phone screening. The screening was very short and basic with questions like, "why are you interested in Children's." I was then asked to come in for an in-person interview with a marketing team. I interviewed with the entire team in groups of two and the entire process was very relaxed, friendly and conversational.
Interview Questions: Have you ever had to handle conflict? How did you do so?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied and it took about a month for them to contact. I had an interview online and was contacted about a second interview. Which was panel. After that they asked for 3 references and background check consent. I think it's safe to say I have the job! :)

title: Process Improvement Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: 1 Phone call with human resources coordinator, Followed by two in person interviews: One with HR and one with Hiring Manager. They are willing to move quickly on the first two interviews but the second one seems to take a little time to set up
Interview Questions: Asked if I was okay with the salary of $60,000

title: Interpreter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta
Interview Descriptions: I've applied for this role a couple of times. One time they called me and did the phone interview but nothig further. Last week they called me to see if I wanted to go interview.
Interview Questions: Behavioral questions

title: Human Resources Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta
Interview Descriptions: I was applying within the company so they interview process from the beginning was pretty speedy. As for the waiting period after the final interview, it was about 3-4 weeks before hearing anything back and that's after calling once a week for an update on the process. It seems like they had forgotten to update the career board that the position had been filled.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in HR?

title: Business Operations Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and took an assessment. A month later I was outreached to by HR and came in for an interview with a supervisor and the director. After the interview, I received another call from HR offering me the position.
Interview Questions: The standard behavioral/ situational questions you would answer using the STAR response format

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Feb 2017

Interview Questions: Why CHOA? Why this floor?

title: Marketing Coordinator Interview

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta in Feb 2017

Interview Questions: What has been your most difficult situation and how did you handle it?

title: Nurse Extern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, 2 weeks later received an email to do an online interview. Interview Questions:
Why are you interested in being a nurse?

title: Unit Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process did not take long. I applied for the job, several days later I got an email about the virtual interview. Completed that and got a call back the same day for second interview.
Interview Questions: How did you overcome a difficult situation?

title: Foundation Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online by submitting my resume and a cover letter. I was then contacted via email to set up a phone interview time. I applied for a foundation intern position.
Interview Questions: Have you ever had to speak to a group in order to persuade?

title: Histotechnician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: The initial communication was via email when my application was selected. You are then given a digital interview,  to which you record your answers and wait to be contacted later if you are qualified. I was then given a different job description from what was posted on the website via email. This was very confusing as the qualifications posted were met by my education and experience. This way of interviewing is new to me since I have only ever had phone and face to face interviews in life.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for CHOA?

title: Nurse Extern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: I filled out the application and that same day I was invitied to do a skype interview. The interview consisted of questions about why do you want to be a nurse and why would you want to work with children. Had to wait another month to hear back to see if I got the position.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to be a nurse?
Why do you want to work with children?
What makes you unique?
Pick 3 units you want to work and tell why.

Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (New York, NY) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: I initially spoke on the phone with a recruiter, than a phone interview with the Director, and in person with the Director and the higher up (separately).  I finally got a phone call that they choose to hire internally.

title: Unit Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta
Interview Descriptions: Applied for the job and around a week later got a call for a video interview. The following week was called to do an in person interview with the supervisor and one of the charge nurses. The next week I was called again to do an interview with the same supervisor and manager of the floor. Accepted the job that day. The whole process is very long, took a month.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with stress, or things changing at the last minute

title: Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very informal meeting.  Discussed basic job expectations, my background and how I would fit in to the new role with Children's Healthcare of Atlanta and why I was interested in moving into pediatric hospital pharmacy after working retail for so long.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in making a career change from retail to hospital?

title: Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interviewers were very professional. Everybody arrived on time and they asked very relevant questions.  There were 5 interviewers from departments of pharmacy and all asked questions that were relevant to their departments
Interview Questions: When are you available to start?

title: Family Experience Liaison Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: Behavioral interviewing - describe a specific example of ____. Spoke with recruiter o phone first; then was selected to interview in-person with recruiter. Later, interviewed with a panel of managers for the department.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you had a conflict with a co-worker.

title: Registration Coordinator Interview

I replied no and they said, "okay good, so you won't have to submit a two weeks notice." I was sure that I got the job, but I didn't.

title: RN Interview

After the phone interview, a face to face interview was scheduled for week later with the nurse manager and assistant nurse manager. After my face to face interview, I set up a day to shadow to see if the position was right for me. A few days later, I received a call with an offer.

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta in Jul 2016

title: Maintenance Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta
Interview Descriptions: HR at CHOA is very bad. They take so long to get back to you or you may never hear from them. My experience has been very negative. My wife works here so I had an employee referral. They called me the first day and it has been 2 months and still have not heard back. The position is still open.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Children's?

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a two hour interview. Everybody was really nice, I would have to say overall the interview went really well. I had interviewed with two people first and did situational type of question. Next was an interview with the clinical pharmacist, and then the supervisor pharmacist. At the end I had an math test which was easy.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online; About a week later, received an email for a phone interview; Had a phone interview the next week; About another week later, received a call for an in person interview; Had an in person interview the following week

Interview Descriptions: If you have a reference, you are SIGNIFICANTLY more likely to get hired. The hire rate is 6% according to orientation, so a reference is crucial. They invite you to interview, which lasted maybe 30-45 min, then you shadow a nurse for 2-3 maybe 4 max hours I believe.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a nurse? What will you do in the face of uncertainty/uncomfortable situations?

Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Macon, GA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Pleasant process and willing to help.  The person was friendly and helpful in listening.  However, my test scores were not what they needed to be and I was not even considered to interview with the hiring manager of the company.

title: Quality Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview was scheduled by the recruiter.  It was a panel interview with a team of 3 individuals.  I was also interviewed by the Director.  I was given the organization chart and a complete introduction to the role and what to expect for the position.
