title: Security Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Two Interviews: the first is with two supervisors and if you are fortunate to get another interview the next will be with the departments manager. They ask normal what would you do questions and the interview is fairly simple.
Interview Questions: Name a time you were challenged by a patron at work.

title: Liaison Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Three people interviewed, went smooth heard back an hour later about shadow process. Overall process took about a month. Health screen and everything scheduled, orientaiton the next week, communicated will through email. Thrilled to be apart of CHOA.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had conflict with a coworker.

title: Orthopedic Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Went well. Kind of intimidating when the head of the ER saw my tattoo when shaking my hand and was rude about it. Online interview first- in person interview a few weeks after. Was asked to shadow that same day. Went and bought scrubs to wear for shadow. Got the job- relocated the day before starting the job.
Interview Questions: What are your short and long term goals?

title: Patient Care Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with two very nice ladies. They both had a copy of my resume and asked question based on that after describing the details of the job. It was very comfortable and at the end they told me that I will be getting a call to schedule my shadowing hours from my recruiter.
Interview Questions: What was your most memorable patient experience?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Recruiter contacts you to set up an interview. I met with the manager for a one on one interview.  At the interview they ask you behavioral questions.  Manager mentioned that I would need to come back and do a second interview and then do a shadowing day.  I withdrew my application because the job wasn't a good fit for me.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you got into a disagreement with a co-worker.  How did you handle it?

title: Patient Care Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta
Interview Descriptions: One on one with manager you will come to the copertate children location not a real hospital and if they like you u will go  to the next step of shadow date.
Interview Questions: Q what you like about helping children. why did u choose childrens

title: Patient Care Tech ER PRN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted for an online interview. Shortly after, I was contacted for an in-person interview. When I went in, they were very dry and really looking at my resume. They almost had no personality. Very introverted! I had all of the necessary qualifications and experience. After the interview, they said they were "moving forward" with my application. They set me up to shadow a pct. I asked when I would find out and they said a week later. Two weeks later I got a call from the recruiter saying they were considering me for a transporter position, not a tech anymore. The whole process took about five weeks.
Interview Questions: What would you do in this situation? Have you ever had a time where you dealt with an angry customer? Why do you want to work here?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: You go through one of their HR recruiters first.  Then a nursing recruiter.  Then you go to the department you are interested in for an interview.  Then you shadow a nurse for 4 hours on that unit.  Questions they ask are on a preprinted form.  HR recruiters seem very disorganized and don't seem to know what the other one is doing.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where you had to deal with...? How do you relax after having a stressful day at work? Do you work well with...?  How would you deal with a last minute assignment change?

title: Customer Resource Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was fairly difficult. It was a panel interview. There were three leadership staff members who were conducting the interview. If are nervous about speaking to more than one person at a time, I suggest practicing the night before the interview.
Interview Questions: Typical questions

title: Dietitian Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied. I contacted someone that I knew there and was given an interview. It was a full day affair. I was treated to lunch. It was pretty grueling at times, but they were fair and asked great questions. I felt very much at ease with everyone there.
Interview Questions: What have you contributed to your current position/program?

title: Anonymous Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: They use a selection known as Targeted Selection meaning they are looking for a S.T.A.R. Always make sure you have an example where everything was NOT perfect. No one wants to have a PERFECT Star.
Interview Questions: Name a time when you disagreed with your.....

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed for the same position in two different. They use a set list of questions. The questions were the same for both departments. They ask all candidates the same questions so that they can rate them against eachother. The interviews felt forced and awkward. I felt weird about the score card, and I didn't really like the whole process. It's hard to get to know someone when the conversation isn't allowed to flow. They also you put you through testing before you can even be recommended for an interview. For an admin role, I took Microsoft office and typing tests. However, the Office tests were based on an old version of Officd that they don't even use anymore. I would have loved to work there, but the interview process was really odd to me.
Interview Questions: How would your handle xxxx situation. All questions were situational.

title: Project Coordinator At the Marcus Autism Center Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the position in November 2014, and was contacted in February 2015 via to see if I was still interested in the position.  Once I responded yes, I received another email with a leaflet about the Talk With Me Baby Project and a request for an interview.  The first interview was with the Lead Research Coordinator and the Director of Infant and Toddler Clinical Research Operations. Although I met the Lead Research Coordinator with a smile and hello in the lobby, her disposition was unfriendly and aggressive in disposition.  We went upstairs to the the Director's office, where the lights were off, the room with lit by natural light, but I found it dark.  The director was seated at a round table on her laptop (which she would continue to work on during the entire interview).  The Lead Research Coordinator interviewed me, and overall it was awkward.
Interview Questions: Behavioral type questions with scenarios...

title: Patient Care Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied on the CHOA website. I had to complete a personality test before I submitted the application. After about two weeks I was emailed to complete a video interview via the internet. The video interview was about 6 questions.  About a 7-10 days later I was asked to come in for an one on interview.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to work at CHOA?
Give an example of how you have dealt with a major change?

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: The process leading up to the interview was pretty smooth.  Filled out the application online and was contacted by their recruiting staff about a week later.  Interview was set up with the laboratory manager.  Showed up for interview, which I thought went well.  Pretty standard questions regarding the laboratory and what the expectations were.  At the end of the interview I asked when I would expect to hear something and was told they had an interview scheduled in 3 weeks and after that they would decide who to call back in for second interviews with the lab directors.  After 4 weeks I e-mailed the recruiter and asked her what the status was.  She told me they were still doing interviews and would be making a decision who to call back the middle of the following week.  But she assured me I was still being considered.  Waited two more weeks and e-mailed again.  Told once again they had more interviews and would make a decision by the end of the week.  Following week, told the same thing again.  After being told "we are going to make a decision this week" 4 weeks in a row I didn't bother following up.  And to date, I still have not heard anything.  I'm glad I didn't get the job as I would have turned it down as I believe this behavior is very unprofessional and rude!  I wouldn't want to work for a place that is this disorganized and unprofessional.  The recruiter should have followed up with me regarding the position.
Interview Questions: What have your past experiences in labs taught you?

title: Social Worker II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was called by the recruiter to schedule an onsite interview with the Social Work Manager. After, I received an email regarding a second interview. The second interview was more of a panel styled interview where I met with multiple social workers and nurses and nurse case managers. The whole interview took about two hours. They asked behavioral style questions. The STAR format will be most helpful. I reached out after a couple of weeks, but never heard anything.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about  a time where you worked as a team?
Tell me about a time you went above and beyond for a patient or family?
Tell me about a time you dealt with an angry family?
Tell a time where you had multiple tasks to complete? How did you prioritize?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta
Interview Descriptions:
Currently they are short staffed in HR so don't take a long response from them personally. Very kind hr staff will do initial screening and phone interview. Then you meet with manager for actual interview. They have set of behavioral questions all managers are required to ask minimum  of 3 or 4 of a set Choa list. They are all very typical tell me a time when...
 From the areas I can remember team work/ getting along with others, critical thinking, dealing with change, work ethic.  Usually ask tell me a time that you made a mistake what was the mistake, what was your response, and outcome?
Interview Questions: None. They were all typical. If you google interview nursing questions and have a pre-thought out senerio for each will be a breeze.

title: Behavioral Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta
Interview Descriptions: Interview consisted of a 8 question packet that asked about personal situations and how you resolved the problem.  Then the interviewer asked job specific questions about past experience and related skills needed to perform the job.
Interview Questions: What do you have over other candidates that would make you a perfect fit for this job.

title: Recruiting Manager/Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was instructed to come to a local office and there was no parking so I had to call to see where to park I was told to park on the street. I went into my appointment my interviewer was 20 minutes late and really did not ask strategic questions. I felt after 15 minutes of waiting I had changed my mind about this company to begin with. I was directed to another interview where I had to sit and wait ten more minutes for the interviewer to show up. Less than professional especially for someone in the business. I had already made my decision in the first ten minutes of waiting.
Interview Questions: How would I work with another new manager. Very open ended question

title: IS&T Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through Children's career portal and was contacted by the recruiter via email then phone. The recruiter set up an interview with the hiring manager within a day. Had a face to face interview with hiring manager and team lead. It was really laid back, everyone was really nice. I would say it was the easiest interview I have even been to. I heard back from the recruiter within a day letting me know the feedback of the interview. The process was pretty quick, with interview, background check, drug test etc all done within a week or so.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Children's

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: Online application with "essay" type questionnaire. Initial interview was online video interview with behavioral questions. Next interview was in-person with a panel. Everyone had watched the online interview and some had follow-up questions from that, but most of the questions were behavioral. Next step was shadowing on the unit. Once I passed that there was a multiple choice nursing exam to take. I was told it was the last "hoop" to jump through and if I pass I'd be getting a job offer. Not true. Passed with flying colors, received a "thanks, but no thanks" email about a month later. Called the recruiter to ask what happened and how I could improve, but she never returned my calls.
Interview Questions: What would your colleagues say that your weaknesses are on the job?

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions:
First interview was via video which consisted on 10 questions about my character and the position in which I was applying.
Second interview was with the recruiter who also gave a ten question written test about the procedures of the position. And he gave an overall description of the position. 
Last interview was a 3 person panel consisting of the dept head, dept supervisor and your potential reporting supervisor. This interview consisted of constant questions about how you would deal with the negatives of the job. It seem as though they wanted someone who has ran into frequent complications and tell how they dealt with it. Everything seemed negative, no positives seemed to be taken into consideration for this particular position. For example: if the computer crashed how would I handle it? My answer was to get the data backed up or handwritten and advise the supervisor of the issue but that wasn't what they was looking for.
Interview Questions: The most difficult questions were those of bad encounters that I didn't see as negatives but instead I was able to continue working

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was called by a reruiter who gave me a brief overview of the position. One day later I then received a call from the Social Work Manager who told to me briefly on the phone; asking me basic questions about my background. She then sent me an email message with interview date and time. For the 1st interview I met with the manager alone. I then met with the SW team. I was interviewed by a panel of 5 Social Workers. The interview lasted about 1 hour. I left and heard back from the 4 weeks later requesting me to return and meet with more social workers and also interview with the unit manager and nurse case manager I will be working directly with. I left and did not hear back from them for another 4 weeks. Where the Social Work manager sent me an email to inquire whether I was still interested. I told her I did. The next day from HR offering me the position.
Interview Questions: Describe your past position and share with us your highlights in that position

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was fast, and they were very accommodating.  There was a total of two interviews.  One was with HR and the other was with the specific unit.
Interview Questions: Any situational question...

title: Senior Applications Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was well done.  Came to HR and sat down with the manager and 2 leads.  They were all great.  They asked questions appropriate to the job I was applying for.  They did have a standard question book they had to go over, which was interesting and fun.  It was professional and laid back.
Interview Questions: What is one of your weaknesses.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview with an HR person. That interview consisted mostly of experience questions.  Next, I had an hour long interview with a hiring manager, and then I shadowed a nurse for 3 hours.  It took over a week to hear back from HR, and then I had to go back in to take a skills test.
Interview Questions: What do you do when you are given information that does not pertain to you?

title: Registration Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: I have always wanted to work for this organization, and over many many applications I finally got an phone interview. From the phone interview you are given information about the position youmight have. Then you will be interviewed by a hiring manager, you might have to interview more than once.
Interview Questions: Tons of behavioral questions!!

title: Foundation Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very effiecient. Both of the team members that interviewed my had put some questions together, which they took turns asking. At the same time it was not super ridgid and formal, we talked openly and I was given time to ask them questions that I had.
Interview Questions: Discuss a major project or work event that you managed, or were mostly responsible for.

title: Nurse Extern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted to schedule a phone interview about 3 days after I had applied online. I had a phone interview where they asked general and behavioral questions. After the phone interview, I had to send off my references. After that they scheduled a second interview which I actually never needed because HR decided to hire me after the first interview.
Interview Questions: Why nursing? What are your top 3 unit choices and why? Name an instance where you had a conflict and how did you deal with it.

title: Access Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: must interview with hiring manager and human resources
Interview Questions: how do you handle high volume pressure

title: Manager Data Analysis Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions:
The hiring manager informally contacted me (as in, prior to HR conversation).  I set up a phone interview with hiring mgr, and in the meantime, spoke to HR.  The phone interview went well, and HR scheduled me to come in for a series of interviews with the hiring mgr, direct reports (for the particular position), and a couple of potential colleagues.  Everyone was very friendly, asked good questions, etc.  I felt it all went well.

The things that I found unimpressive about this situation were almost all based in HR.  When I arrived at the HR building (I drove in from a neighboring state), no one there officially greeted me.  I was taken to a conference room, and I wasn't offered a thing.  In any other situation, I've been offered water, coffee, etc.  I thought it was strange that I never met the recruiter.  I ended up not getting the offer (which was communicated via email), and I understand the hiring mgr is still trying to determine what he truly needs in a candidate.
Interview Questions: The questions were all fairly standard.  Nothing stood out as a particularly difficult question.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta
Interview Descriptions: The hiring and interview process was smooth and easy.
Interview Questions: Very focused on behavioral scenario questions

title: Scheduler Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Was decent and laid back. It was also kind of short time for an interview. The team of schedulers also came in to meet me and allowed me to ask questions and they also asked me questions.
Interview Questions: Can I handle high volume of calls and some times parents who are stressed out.

title: Dental Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was a very long four hour interview process, I met with many different department heads and office staff before actually sitting down for my interview. I spoke with the director of dentistry as well as their clinical coordinator. I was then given a run down of how things work in that department and as told that this was a non profit agency and they had to review other candidates before getting back to me.
Interview Questions: My availability and why I wanted to work for this company?

title: Registration Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: Found a job listed on craigslist and applied on the Children's website.  Had 3 in person interviews and was not selected for the job.  Called the director and explained that I felt that I had been pulled around when they already knew the were going to hire an internal person. Was told they had another position available - the registration job, interviewed one more time and was offered the position.
Interview Questions: Nothing stands out special about the interview it was a behavioral interview and it was typical.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Online application --> Phone interview with recruiter --> Face-to-Face interview --> Opportunity to observe current nursing staff in area of interest.
Interview Questions: What is your philosophy of nursing?

title: Image Processing Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: I got a call from HR about setting up a phone interview. First interview was mostly the discussion regarding the position and the lady said they will contact me regarding the next interview. I received an email after two days  from the HR lady setting up the interview  for the next day. In this interview I was asked about my experience and the projects. I was informed after three weeks of the interview that somebody else with more cardiac experience was selected for the position.
Interview Questions: What do you think will interest you more - application based position or optimization related position?

title: Marketing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (North Atlanta, GA) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Communications in order to set up the interview were difficult. I heard from one person to set up the interview, but then didn't hear back. Weeks later I heard from a completely different person, but didn't receive solid interview information for another two weeks. Once there, they paid me attention, but did not receive confirmation of job choice without a few email prompts to HR. Disappointed in the service.
Interview Questions: If you could do any job, what would it be?

title: Performance Improvement Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: Received a call from an internal HR and spoke for few minutes, then she scheduled me in for an onsite interview. Arrived on time and was taken for my first interview with the Hiring Manager. We spoke about the job and he asked some situation type questions. then The next interview with the team was super weird. The three people in the team that interviewed me were all brought in by each other and someone that works within the organization. So this begs the question, if any three of them have someone in mind (of which they would considering the job climate), what chance do I have?
Interview Questions: Questions were really basic

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: They have you do a video interview with a robot and take a personality quiz. Literally the worst interview process ever. Then they have two managers in on your sit down interview and ask the same type of questions every other interview asks. Trick questions that do not allow you to show your strengths. Why are we still asking people to assign themselves a weakness? What's your greatest weakness? My Achilles heel?
Interview Questions: Describe a difficult patient encounter and how you handled it.

title: Credentialing Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by the HR team for phone interview and pre-screen and then was asked to come in person for an interview within two weeks.  The interview process was fairly simple and straight forward.  The interview was only held with the hiring manager for the position and I was offered a position with two weeks of the interview.  I would recommend researching the company ahead of the interview and come prepared with questions about the work you'll be doing and about the company's values and mission.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Special Events Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: I called the company to inquire about availability of vacancies.  Was invited by the Event Director to interview.  First appointment was highly informal, just the two of us discussing what drew us to the company.  We also discussed what we each hoped to benefit from a new hire, as a supervisor and contractor.  I was offered the position and accepted immediately.
Interview Questions: Why choose Children's over another nonprofit agency?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: Typical behavioral interview/conversational.  Met with Recruiter, met with several current employees for panel interview, and met with a company psychologist for personality testing.  The interviews took place over the course of about 3 days.
Interview Questions: Typical interview questions about most recent work experience, skill set, job motivation, achievements, etc.

title: IS Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with the HR Recruiter and a week later with the manager and director. The process has  become more complex where candidate interviews with HR then a hireview interview, then 2 panels consisting of 3 people each.
Interview Questions: Specific PM Questions - What are the triple constraints of Project Management

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process involved two interviews. Some of the questions were a little strange, but I tried to give the answers they wanted to hear and not what I thought was the right thing to say. There was an aptitude test, a background check, and a drug test. It took about a month until I learned I had the job.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a manager told you to collect information on a colleague?

title: Writer/Editor, Marketing Department Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interviewing process was fine. I had to interview with a few different people, but nothing was out of the ordinary.
Interview Questions: How did I handle change?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed first with Nurse Recruiter, then Unit Manager and finally HR.  All 3 were courteous and seemed genuinely interested in my experience.  I took a skills test with the HR department before meeting in person with them, which was really common sense nursing scenarios.  All of my questions about hours, requirements and unit policies were answered during those sessions.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation in which you provided excellent customer service.

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was seamless. I was contacted by a recruiter and they arranged the interview. It was scheduled within 2 days. HR provided logistics to the recruiting firm and the firm passed the information to me; however, after the interview, HR back peddled and refused to honor what was specified in terms of payment for parking. The interview was less than hour.
Interview Questions: Questions were job specific, technical and behavioral. It was a typical interview centered around competences. There were a few case scenario questions to gauge knowledge and GAAP basics.

title: Maintenance Mechanic Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: Very slow process. First was a phone interview with a recruiter and then a face to face with manager and supervisors of dept. Then the recruiter called with an offer which I accepted, the background check seems to take weeks. Everything else was smooth sailing. After hire you go to their hub location for 2 day orientation to learn about all benefits/and policies.
Interview Questions: Why would I be an asset to their team?

title: Operations Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: Seemed ill-prepared. Interview was changed to a phone interview at the last minute. Confusion with what number to call for the interview. It all began to seem like it was an annoying formality on the employer's side.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions:
Initial interview with Human Resources Business Partner.
Phone interview with hiring manager.
Daylong interview with other managers.
Interview Questions: Approximately 3 hours of testing done with industrial psychologist.

title: Quality Control Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Dec 2010
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was a mess. The job I applied for was Quality Control and per the job posting it was a full-time position. In the interview I was informed it was a PRN position & that the job posting was incorrect. Had to wait for a manager to confirm with Human Resources that they still had the posting up for the ROI Specialist. I then interviewed for that position instead. My interview was scheduled and rescheduled several times. The experience was very disorganized and unprofessional. The main reason I accepted the job is that I was not happy in my current employment & had heard wonderful things about this company....very disappointed.
Interview Questions: Give your definition of customer service.

title: Patient Access Quality Assurance Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: I had been working with a recruiter for the organization since I had applied to a previous position and did not get an offer.  My resume was given to the hirring manager.  She approved for me to take a personality test.  After compelting I was scheduled for a face to face interview with two people.  I was living in Atlanta and came to Texas for the interview.  I paid for my own travel.  During the interview most of the questions were behavioral questions where you were put on the spot to answer situations that you had experienced.  The problem was that there might of been questions where you didnt have an actual answer because it never happened.  They didnt want any hypothetical answers.  After the pannel interview I spoke with the National Manager in another city.  I completed a phone interview.  I was offered the position within a few days.  The entire process was about 2-3 weeks.  After I accepted I had to complete a background check, financial check and drug screening.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you didnt agree with the direction you manager gave you.

title: Human Resources Business Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions:
I was contacted by a Recruiter regarding a position I applied for on the Children Healthcare careers website. The Recruiter conducted a phone interview. She was friendly and detailed, and very professional. She contacted me a few days later and indicated that they wanted to schedule an onsite interview. Everything was handled in an organized manner. I received confirmation of the onsite interview via email. 

I interviewed with the Recruiter and HR Director during my onsite interview process. Both individuals were prepared and fully engaged, and communicated well during both interviews.

Following the interview, I sent an email thanking both individuals for the time they had taken. I never received any form of communication following the onsite interviews, and my subsequent emails. No phone call to let me know that they were moving forward with another candidate, nor a simple email communicating this decision. As a result, I was not impressed with the organization nor my experience overall.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Marketing Manager Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Children's Healthcare of Atlanta (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2008
Interview Descriptions: Must apply online initially. Next steps include phone screen, panel interview with your potential team and 1:1 with director and above as applicable. Prepare to address questions with specific examples, your actions and the results of your efforts.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you made a mistake. What was the mistake, and what steps did you take to address it?
